Simulate Gaussian equi-correlated test statistics

Simulate Gaussian equi-correlated test statistics

simulateEqui(m, rho, B, pi0, SNR = 1)

Arguments

m

Number of hypotheses
rho

Level of equi-correlation between pairs of variables
B

Number of simulations
pi0

Proportion of true null hypotheses
SNR

Signal to noise ratio. Either a numeric value (a measure of distance between H0 and H1) or a vector of length m*(1-pi0)

Value

A list with elements

x

A vector of length \(m\) test statistics

X0

An \(m x B\) matrix of test statistics under the null hypothesis

H

A vector of length \(m\), the status of each hypothesis: 0 for true null hypothesis, and 1 for true alternative hypothesis

Examples


m <- 123
rho <- 0.2
B <- 100
pi0 <- 0.5

sim <- simulateEqui(m, rho, B, pi0, SNR=1)
stat <- sim$x

## show test statistics
pch <- 20
colStat <- 1+sim$H
plot(stat, col=colStat, main="Test statistics", pch=pch)
legend("topleft", c("H0", "H1"), pch=pch, col=1:2)

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
